comments.author: Hillary
comments.content: Beautifully presented dish! How do you know what flowers are edible - where do you find them?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks Hillary! Here is an excellent reference page for edible flowers: http://whatscookingamerica.net/EdibleFlowers/EdibleFlowersMain.htm . Of course you should always cross-check to be sure you are comfortable.

comments.content:
This sounds wonderful on top on getting extra points for being beautiful! I too, have tons of chive and rosemary flowers. For some reason it hadn't occurred to me to use those. Duh. I use them in pictures all the time, why not in food? Just call me lighting. Thank you.

Ooo, I love hollandaise!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: The chive flowers taste oniony, very nice. Since I originally made this dish, I've discovered that I like them better if you break them down into the individual flowerlets - the whole flower is a bit too much of a puffball in the mouth but the little bits are great.
